strings.Value: "My, my, whom do we have here? If it isn't Tigni Jusmert, the renowned merchant! Fallen on hard times, have you?"
"Watch your tongue, or you'll stay in that cage forever!"
"I've had to deal with dozens of goblins on my way here, so a few more are of little concern. Who are you?"
"Be silent! Of course I'm setting you free — calm down and let me deal with the lock, will you?"
"Free you? What do I get out of it if I do?"
"I don't like you all that much. I think you should remain here, and we'll let the goblins decide what to do with you."
"All right, come out. I hope you can find your way out of the camp."
"Hmm... no. Farewell."
"What, are you scared? All right, coward, I'll let you out. Then get out of my sight."
"Oh, are you still alive? Lucky you! All right then, see you soon."
"Hmm... If I let you out... what do I get in return?"
"What were the others talking about? Did you cheat those people?"
"You! Yes, you there! Let me out of here! Come on, move it, are you waiting for the entire goblin horde to show?"

{n}Tigni's face falls at your tone. Since you last met him in {g|Kamelands}Kamelands{/g}, the merchant has lost weight. His clothes are torn and dirty, and he has lost his worn-out beret. He is clutching onto the bars of the cage so tightly his fingers have gone white.{/n}
"Your Grace... what a surprise... yourself, in person... {mf|sir|madam}... would you be so kind as to help me out of this... ah, predicament?"

{n}A corpulent man in a ragged jacket and worn-out trousers is in the cage, his hands tight on the bars as if trying to throttle them.{/n} "Tigni Jusmert, a free merchant! Now that formalities are out of the way, can you see about setting me free?"

{n}The corpulent man in a ragged jacket and worn-out trousers hangs his head.{/n} "No, I beg of you! Don't leave me here! The goblins — they're up to something horrible! I'm Tigni Jusmert, an honest trader. By the mercies of {g|Abadar}Abadar{/g}, please free me!"
"Don't let him out! He's a scoundrel — he never misses a chance to fleece honest, hard-working folk, and he even shakes down the refugees! He has no shame!"
"You had it coming, wretch! Where are your thugs now, Tigni? Having a hard time sleeping on the dung mat? Let him rot in this cage — or in a goblin's belly, I don't care!"
"No, no — don't listen to them! I've no idea what they are on about! Would you let an innocent man die because of lies and gossip?"

{n}Tigni's eyes widen in horror, and he licks his lips. Sweating profusely, he presses his face against the bars and whispers.{/n} "You know the bridge over {g|Gudrin River}Gudrin river{/g}? Down the stream, not far from {g|Tuskwater}Tuskwater{/g}? On the same side as the barony, there are bushes growing near the road and the bridge. I... I buried a little something there, under one of the bushes — it's yours if you let me out!"
{n}Tigni's eyes widen.{/n} "What do you get OUT of it?! WHAT DO YOU GET OUT OF IT?! You'll save a living soul! NOW GET ME OUT OF THIS CAGE!"
{n}Tigni is staring at you, his face white and his eyes wide. As you watch, a bead of sweat rolls down his temple.{/n}

"Wh-what? N-no, nothing of the like! Slander and nonsense, all of it!"
{n}Tigni shakes his head and forces a smile, but the perspiration on his forehead exposes the lie.{/n}

"What? No, nothing of the like! Slander and nonsense, all of it!"
{n}Tigni's eyes are pleading.{/n} "You wouldn't leave me here to be torn to bits by these vermin because of gossip, would you?"
"Ha ha! Man, what a speech! You sound just like a preacher. 'Save a living soul' my ass. Why should we care about your soul if it can't cough up payment for saving it?"
